alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; City of Richmond; Hanover; Henrico (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 6:51PM EST until January 09 at 11:30PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EST THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL CHESTERFIELD, SOUTHEASTERN HANOVER AND HENRICO COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF RICHMOND... At 651 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Richmond, Ashland, Virginia Commonwealth University, Virginia Union University, Downtown Richmond, Highland Springs, Mechanicsville, University Of Richmond, Bon Air, Tuckahoe, Chester, Hanover, East Highland Park, Lakeside, Bensley, Laurel, Glen Allen, Bellwood, Studley and Chesterfield Court House. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Chesterfield; City of Richmond; Hanover; Henrico
